nodes.bodyText: let's use replicated instead of broadcast. That's how we call DFs in rest of codebase
I used broadcast instead of replicated here because in FeatureConfig the user facing strings use broadcast (join-distribution-type=BROADCAST and join-max-broadcast-table-size)
please change name to smallBroadcastMaxRowCountPerDriver. It's more English like and consistent with smallBroadcastRangeRowLimitPerDriver. Similar for other fields
Please io.prestosql.testing.DistributedQueryRunner.Builder#setSingleExtraProperty instead of relying on DF defaults. Please add a comment why we need to change property in first place
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -86,7 +86,7 @@ protected Session getSession()
         return Session.builder(super.getSession())
                 .setSystemProperty(JOIN_REORDERING_STRATEGY, NONE.name())
                 .setSystemProperty(JOIN_DISTRIBUTION_TYPE, PARTITIONED.name()) // Avoid node local DF
-                .setSystemProperty(DYNAMIC_FILTERING_RANGE_ROW_LIMIT_PER_DRIVER, "100000")
+                .setSystemProperty(ENABLE_LARGE_DYNAMIC_FILTERS, "true")

nodes.bodyText: Explicitly added dynamic-filtering.large-partitioned.max-distinct-values-per-driver to query runner and added comments

nodes.bodyText: let's make it 5_000 rows and 100KB. That gives 80_000 rows (16x drivers) per DF. It's still more than most connectors can accept.
Let's make it 500 and 10KB. Essentially 10x smaller than for broadcast
change name to getDynamicFilteringMaxRowCountPerDriver (and similar to others)

nodes.bodyText: updated max annotation for large-partitioned.max-size-per-driver to 5MB, large-broadcast.max-size-per-driver to 50MB and kept it capped at 1MB for the small DF cases.

Maybe call it testJoinLargeBuildSideRangeDynamicFiltering
Also, we are missing test case for "too" large build side for DFs to be collected. It would be good to restore it, but it's not critical
agreed, I'll add the too-large-no-df test as well in a different PR
